meanings.sent1: She was insufflating air into the balloon to make it bigger.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter was insufflating oxygen into the patient's lungs.
meanings.sent3: The clown was insufflating helium into the balloon animals, making them float comically.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to be insufflating life into the sails of the boat.
meanings.sent5: The teacher demonstrated insufflating air into the science experiment, causing a reaction.

meanings.definition: To introduce (a substance) into the body by breathing or blowing
meanings.sent1: He was insufflating medicine into his body to feel better.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was insufflating anesthesia into the patient before surgery.
meanings.sent3: The chef was insufflating spices into the dish, creating a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist seemed to be insufflating creativity into every stroke of the brush.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was insufflating energy drinks before the race to boost performance.

meanings.definition: To inhale forcefully through the nose
meanings.sent1: She was insufflating the scent of the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The child was insufflating the aroma of freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent3: The detective was insufflating the smell of the crime scene, trying to gather clues.
meanings.sent4: The hiker felt like insufflating the fresh mountain air into his lungs.
meanings.sent5: The chef was insufflating the fragrant steam rising from the pot of soup.
